company_description: EverDriven Technologies is an asset-lite provider of alternative transportation services to the K-12 end-market, with a focus on high-needs student populations such as special education, homeless and foster students. The company’s technology platform facilitates more than 2 million rides annually, helping school districts provide safe, reliable and efficient transportation. EverDriven has proprietary technology supporting routing optimization, real-time trip monitoring, compliance management and mobile applications for drivers and parents. Student safety is EverDriven’s highest priority, and the company ensures drivers and vehicles meet its robust safety requirements with a strong safety track record.

Rise Growth Partners is a synergistic partner for growth-oriented registered investment advisors (RIAs). Rise aims to acquire meaningful minority stakes in a select group of RIAs and provide strategic support, hands-on operational guidance, recruiting assistance and acquisition expertise to enable those partner RIAs to accelerate growth and efficiently scale into next-generation wealth management platforms. Rise is led by a team of seasoned industry executives and operators with extensive wealth management and growth company experience.

Searchlight Cyber is a global dark web intelligence company, primarily serving enterprise cybersecurity professionals, managed security service providers, and government and law enforcement agencies across Europe and North America. Searchlight’s user-friendly platform provides mission-critical dark web intelligence to meet a core need: helping customers both detect and prevent cybercrime. Since it was founded in 2017, Searchlight has supported some of the world’s largest dark web investigations.

Petra Funds Group is a leading fund administrator for private investment firms, providing comprehensive fund administration and related middle and back-office services to private equity and private debt managers totaling more than $110 billion of AUM. Founded by executives with decades of experience in the private funds industry, the firm offers end-to-end technology-enabled fund administration, investor servicing, compliance, fund launch advisory, management company and ESG services. Petra delivers a differentiated, client-centric value proposition with white-glove service that has enabled the firm to gain market share and achieve consistent client satisfaction. The firm has 110+ employees across five offices in the US and Europe.

Salus GRC is a tech-enabled governance, risk and compliance (“GRC”) consulting firm to private fund managers and other financial services firms. Offerings include regulatory registration and filing services, compliance program development and ongoing support, regulatory exam assistance, compliance training and education, regulatory due diligence, and cybersecurity consulting. Salus GRC aspires to be the employer of choice in the compliance industry, attracting experienced professionals who bring a focus on providing the highest level of client service.

Maltego (or the “Company”) is a graphical link analysis software platform used by investigators for cybersecurity threat intelligence, law enforcement, and trust & safety use cases. Institutions such as the FBI and INTERPOL, many financial organizations, and half of the DOW 30 rely on Maltego software to visually map and connect a large volume and variety of data (e.g., external Open-Source Intelligence (OSINT), third-party commercial data sources and customers’ internal proprietary data) to rapidly conduct investigations and identify threat actors. Maltego seeks to be the tool of choice for investigators, with its minimal setup requirements, ease of use, rapid time to value and diverse out-of-the-box data integrations.

ImageQuix (or the “Company”) is a leading provider of workflow and ecommerce software for high-volume photography studios, primarily serving schools for their annual picture days, sports photos and senior portraits. Its platform is the core operational software used by these studios and is deeply embedded in its customers’ businesses, resulting in a high degree of customer stickiness. The Company digitizes the photographer’s end-to-end workflow, including: photo capture and organization; customization and package creation; and follow-up marketing and payment. With its unique integration of workflow and ecommerce capabilities, ImageQuix has pioneered technological adoption in the industry, especially as photography studios have transitioned to a fully online workflow. The Company offers sophisticated functionality and stands out in the market with its ability to enhance the consumer experience and provide a broader assortment of products at competitive prices.

Titan Cloud Software is the nation’s leading software platform providing environmental and operational solutions for convenience stores (“c-stores”), fuel carriers and service providers. Founded in 2012, Titan provides industry-leading solutions for environmental compliance, fuel analytics and facility management, so that clients can prevent or minimize the environmental and financial impact of fuel leaks, automate compliance and regulatory workflows, obtain real-time fuel-level visibility, and seamlessly manage maintenance processes. Titan’s software and solutions are trusted by over 700 global customers across more than 60,000 facilities, including some of the largest c-store chains and commercial fleets in the world. The Company employs 74 people across three offices in North America and Australia.

Action Behavior Centers (“ABC”) provides personalized therapy for children with autism, with the goal of expanding their potential and improving their quality of life. Founded as a single center in Austin, TX, in 2016, ABC currently employs approximately 400 graduate-level clinicians and operates more than 100 centers across Texas, Colorado, Arizona and Illinois. ABC uses center-based Applied Behavior Analysis (“ABA”) treatment, which is widely considered the gold standard in autism treatment by payors and clinicians; ABA helps children ages 2-14 years old reduce symptoms of autism spectrum disorder (“ASD”), such as self-harm and aggression.

Accordion is a financial and technology consulting firm serving the Office of the CFO for private equity portfolio companies. Accordion’s consultants work alongside more than 200 leading fund sponsors and their portfolio management teams across every stage of the investment lifecycle. The Company’s solutions include operational and technical accounting, strategic financial planning and analysis, CFO-driven transformation, CFO technology, transaction execution, public company readiness, interim leadership, and turnaround and restructuring. Headquartered in New York, Accordion has 10 offices across the country, also including Atlanta, Boston, Charlotte, Chicago, Dallas, Detroit, Los Angeles, San Francisco, and South Florida. Due to its hands-on, results-oriented execution, Accordion is widely recognized as the leading consultancy to private equity CFOs and has established a track record of consistent organic growth and acquisitions since its founding in 2009. Accordion has also been recognized as an employer of choice for its “better way to work in finance” philosophy.

Bridgepointe Technologies is a leading IT channel platform selling recurring technology services to enterprise customers. Bridgepointe serves as a vendor- and technology-agnostic advisor helping enterprises purchase the right technology and services to meet their needs. Bridgepointe is highly diversified with a network of more than 450 sales agents, known as IT Strategists, who serve over 6,000 mid-to-large enterprise customers nationwide. End customers benefit from receiving unbiased, well-researched technology recommendations and enhanced personal service at no incremental cost.

BOX Partners (“BOX” or the “Company”) is a leading technology-enabled supplier of packaging, shipping, industrial supplies and related products for the e-commerce and distribution markets. Family-owned since its 1989 inception, the Company has grown to one of the country’s largest wholesalers of packaging products, offering both distribution and e-commerce customers a broad product selection, the ability to integrate with IT systems and expertise at small-order fulfillment. The Company is distinguished by its ability to aggregate and efficiently fulfill millions of orders on behalf of its distributor partners, providing access to over 1 million square feet of virtual warehouse space with over 20,000 items.

Mediaocean (or the “Company”) is a leading software platform serving advertising agencies and brands with a suite of software products for ad campaign management, execution and delivery. Its platform serves as the system-of-record for ad spend and has a full suite of products for ad agencies and marketers to manage and deliver their advertising programs. Mediaocean is based in New York City and employs 1,200 people across 20 offices globally. With more than $200 billion in annualized media spend managed through its software, Mediaocean connects brands, agencies, media, technology, and data. Using software to give customers control over marketing investments and optimize business outcomes, Mediaocean powers end-to-end advertising campaigns from planning, buying and selling to analysis, invoices and payments.

Founded in 1959 and headquartered outside Chicago, Empire Today (“Empire” or the “Company”) is the largest direct-to-consumer (“DTC”) provider of replacement hard surface flooring and carpet, serving over 70 of the largest US metropolitan areas. Featuring a wide selection of carpet and hard surface flooring products for homes, Empire also sells fully installed flooring solutions to small businesses and property managers. An iconic brand well-known for its “800-588-2300 Empire Today” jingle, the Company has a differentiated business model which simplifies the consumer experience through a free in-home estimate and sales consultation, a targeted product assortment and a coordinated professional installation.

SOLVE (or the “Company”) is a global industry leader of pre-trade price transparency data in fixed income markets. SOLVE leverages machine learning and natural language processing-based parsing software to transform large volumes of undigestible, unstructured bid-ask data (emails, instant messages, etc.) into clean and navigable structured data for its clients. The Company also hosts a proprietary, large and continuously expanding fixed income pricing dataset. These solutions are deeply integrated into the workflow of SOLVE’s customers, spanning blue-chip financial institutions across the buy-side, sell-side, market data vendors and evaluated pricing service providers. Founded in 2011, SOLVE is led by its co-founders, who have extensive expertise in fixed income and developing cutting edge data and machine learning products.

Founded in 2000, MDVIP (or the “Company”) is the largest provider of membership-based healthcare, or concierge medicine, in the United States. The Company manages a network of approximately 1,100 primary care physicians serving 362,000 patient members across 44 states. MDVIP provides highly personalized preventative care, including comprehensive annual health screening, same-day appointments and 24/7 access to physicians – a differentiated delivery model that drives demonstrated improvements in health outcomes. MDVIP physicians benefit from enhanced compensation and earnings stability, smaller practices, greater job satisfaction, and administrative and strategic support.

symplr (or the “Company”) is the leader in enterprise healthcare operations software and services. For more than 30 years and with deployments in nine out of every 10 US hospitals, symplr has been committed to improving healthcare operations through its cloud-based solutions, driving better operations for better outcomes. Its provider data management and workforce management as well as its healthcare governance, risk management and compliance (GRC) solutions, improve the efficiency and efficacy of healthcare operations, enabling caregivers to quickly handle administrative tasks so they have more time to do what they do best — provide high-quality patient care.

Lido Advisors is a full-service, independent Registered Investment Advisor (“RIA”) that brings an innovative family office investment approach to grow and safeguard its clients’ wealth and legacies. Lido’s clients include high-net-worth and ultra-high-net-worth individuals, family offices, corporate executives, non-profit organizations and foundations. Founded in 1999, Lido is now one of the fastest-growing RIAs in the United States, owing to its unique and differentiated downside-protected investment model. The company currently has over $9 billion in assets under management and a national presence, with offices in 12 major metropolitan areas, including Los Angeles, San Diego, San Francisco, Scottsdale, Dallas, Chicago, Boca Raton, Atlanta and Washington DC. Lido plans to continue its expansion across the country both organically and through acquisition.

Ivanti is a leading global provider of enterprise IT software. The company provides solutions that automate IT and security operations, enabling customers to discover, manage, secure and service their IT infrastructure from cloud environments to edge devices. Ivanti’s software is utilized by over 40,000 customers across various industries and five continents, including 78 of The Fortune 100. The company’s mission-critical products are deeply embedded in customers’ IT operations, resulting in strong net retention and consistent recurring revenue growth. Ivanti has also completed 10 acquisitions since 2015, meaningfully increasing its scale and addressable market while strengthening its product portfolio. The company has an attractive and actionable M&A pipeline in place which we expect to support continued inorganic growth.

City Brewing is a strategic partner to leading beverage manufacturers, providing brewing, filtration, blending and packaging services at its three breweries in Pennsylvania, Tennessee and Wisconsin. The company specializes in hard seltzer and other flavored malt beverages (FMB), as well as ready-to-drink cocktails and other fast-growing segments of the premium alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverage market. The largest contract manufacturer in the FMB market, City Brewing has grown significantly as consumer preferences have shifted from traditional beer, wine and spirits to FMB products. This market shift has been driven by macro health and wellness trends supporting lower-calorie alternative beverages and by increased consumer demand for ready-to-drink, portable alcoholic beverages with a wide variety of flavor profiles.

Founded in 2007, MB2 Dental (“MB2” or the “Company”) is a leading dental partnership organization (“DPO”) with affiliated practices across more than 30 states. Since its 2007 inception, MB2 has partnered with over 250 doctor owners operating more than 275 dental practices. Given their unique doctor-centric culture and joint-venture partnership model, MB2 has become one of the country’s fastest-growing dental platforms, affiliating with more than 300 practices since 2018. Doctor owners who choose to partner with the Company are entrepreneurial and focused on accelerating the growth of their businesses. MB2 has demonstrated an ability to add value post-acquisition by providing best-in-class support to practices, alleviating administrative burdens, and expanding specialty dentistry services.

Bridges Consumer Healthcare was established in partnership with industry veterans to build a market-leading consumer healthcare platform. At its formation in 2019, Bridges acquired the North American rights to ThermaCare® HeatWraps from GlaxoSmithKline. ThermaCare is a portfolio of clinically proven heat wraps for pain relief. In 2020, Bridges acquired Clarion Brands, a scale OTC business anchored by premier brands that target specialty conditions.

Healthcare Fraud Shield (“HCFS”) is a leading provider of Fraud, Waste and Abuse (“FWA”) detection software to healthcare payers.  Founded in 2011, the company is one of the fastest growing providers of FWA solutions in the healthcare industry.  HCFS offers a next-generation SaaS platform that uses proprietary data, artificial intelligence, rules and algorithms to enable payers to identify FWA claims, driving meaningful cost savings and a high ROI for customers.  In addition, the platform provides workflow and productivity tools that significantly enhance payer efficiency.  The platform is fully integrated, addressing the entire range of pre-payment and post-payment workflows with a combined view of both medical and pharmacy claims.  HCFS is led by a management team with notable experience building successful fraud detection businesses in other verticals.

American Residential Services is a leading provider of heating and air conditioning (HVAC) and plumbing services nationwide. ARS primarily serves homeowners in need of emergency repair and replacement services for heating, air conditioning, energy efficiency, plumbing, drain cleaning and sewer lines. It operates under two well-known national brands, ARS and Rescue Rooter, as well as through trusted local brands in select markets.

Aptean is a leading global provider of mission-critical, industry-specific enterprise resource planning (“ERP”) software that allows its customers to digitize administrative functions and drive efficiency in their operations. Aptean predominantly serves small- to medium-sized businesses in the process and discrete manufacturing end-markets. With a portfolio of over 35 products, the company provides ERP solutions that are tailor-made for industries including food and beverage, apparel, specialized tooling and industrial machinery, pharmaceuticals and medical devices, and specialty chemicals. Products also include supply chain, compliance, payments, CRM, and PLM software offerings. Aptean serves over 10,000 customers in more than 80 countries across a wide range of industries. The company has established a strong M&A strategy, with 27 acquisitions signed or completed since our investment, and has developed a leadership position in food and beverage manufacturing, a segment that Charlesbank knows well. We expect to leverage our relationships in this vertical and our experience with software buy-and-build strategies to be a value-added partner to Aptean.

Cyberbit is a leading global provider of cyber range training and simulation platforms for cybersecurity professionals. Cyberbit’s software creates the environment of a virtual security operations center (called a cyber range) that cybersecurity professionals use to train against hyper-realistic simulated attacks, thereby improving their capabilities to respond to real-world situations. Cyberbit was founded as the cybersecurity division of Elbit Systems, an international high-technology company engaged in a wide range of defense, homeland security and commercial programs throughout the world. Originally developed exclusively for the Israeli Defense Force, in recent years the cyber range product was commercialized and sold more broadly. Today, Cyberbit’s software is used by leading enterprises, government agencies, educational institutions and managed service providers across the globe for mission-critical cybersecurity training and simulation.

Neptune Retail Solutions (fka, News America Marketing, or NAM) is a leading provider of shopper marketing services across the US and Canada, serving many of the world’s most well-known brands. The company has two primary segments in the US: InStore (~51% of revenue) and AtHome (~37% of revenue), with the remainder of revenue split between digital marketing and Canada. The InStore segment provides marketing products and services to consumer packaged goods (CPG) companies through a network of thousands of retail locations, with products that include sign and display advertising and shopping cart advertising. The AtHome segment prints and distributes marketing and incentive products (e.g., coupon books) for CPG companies and retailers, mainly via newspapers and US mail. Neptune currently has a network of over 60,000 retail locations and a field work force of over 4,000 to execute in-store advertising. Its diverse customer base includes more than 500 CPG customers and over 100 retailer partners.

Wayfair is the largest pure-play ecommerce company addressing the $300 billion furniture and home goods market in the United States. Through technology and innovation, Wayfair strives to offer the ultimate home goods shopping experience, with excellent customer service, attractive pricing and a selection of more than 18 million items across home furnishings, décor, home improvement, housewares and more.  Founded in Boston in 2002, the company operates primarily through its website, Wayfair.com. Its family of sites also includes Joss & Main, AllModern, Birch Lane and Perigold. Trading publicly on the New York Stock Exchange since its 2014 IPO, the company serves customers in the US, Canada, the UK and Germany.

Founded in 2012, World Insurance Associates offers comprehensive insurance coverage, risk management strategies, and benefits consulting services for businesses and individuals. Focused on property and casualty lines, the company has built centers of excellence in specialized industries such as transportation, self-storage facilities, non-profits and construction. World operates 40 offices in 12 states and has become one of the country’s fastest-growing insurance brokerages through a combination of organic growth and agency acquisitions, with 55 completed at the time of acquisition.

Fortra (formerly, HelpSystems) is a leading provider of security and compliance, systems and network management, and business intelligence solutions. The company serves more than 17,000 organizations globally, providing their IT departments with software and services that encrypt and secure data, monitor and automate processes, and enable access to information. Founded in 1982, Fortra has offices around the world and customers ranging in size from small businesses to Fortune 500 organizations.

PakEnergy (formerly WolfePak) is a leading provider of enterprise resource planning (ERP) and accounting software to the oil and gas industry, including oil and gas operators, midstream companies and mineral rights investors. The company’s mission-critical products are tailored to the highly specific accounting, operational and regulatory needs of this industry. PakEnergy’s software is sold via Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) and perpetual license models directly to a broad base of over 1,300 customers, primarily in Texas, Oklahoma, Louisiana and other energy-producing states. The company is poised for growth as oil and gas firms in this segment of the market are increasingly adopting technology to increase productivity and manage industry accounting complexity.

DoiT International is a leading provider of proprietary public cloud optimization and operations software and public cloud expertise. The company provides support for public cloud workloads with complex requirements such as multi-cloud Kubernetes deployments, real-time data and analytics, and machine intelligence. Its software platform uses machine learning to enable customers to right-size workloads and optimize their public cloud spend across any of the three major public cloud providers. The company serves over 475 customers in more than 25 countries. DoiT’s solution provides meaningful cost savings to customers within 90 days of their onboarding, and the company’s engineering consultancy helps customers design applications and deployments optimally for multi-cloud environments.

Park Place Technologies is a global data center and networking optimization firm, helping clients optimize data center budgets, productivity, performance, and sustainability. From procurement to decommissioning, the company’s comprehensive portfolio of services and products helps IT teams optimize IT lifecycle management. The company has expertise across all major OEMs and capabilities to support more than 22,000 customers annually across the globe.

MyEyeDr. is the leading optometry platform in North America, and the company’s affiliated practices provide vision care services including eye exams, prescription eye glasses and contact lenses. MyEyeDr. is an acquirer of choice, known for combining healthcare and eyewear best practices under one operating model.

Founded in 1971, Reef sells beach-inspired footwear to department stores, surfing-focused retailers, sporting goods stores, and through its owned e-commerce site. Focused on an active lifestyle, it sells millions of flip flops, sandals and shoes annually worldwide.

Hearthside Food Solutions is the industry’s largest food contract manufacturer and the largest private bakery in the US. Founded in 2009, it offers diverse production capabilities including bars, cookies, crackers, granola, snack components and other baked goods. Hearthside specializes in the production of complex, high-volume, short-run products, which represent an increasing portion of customer demand. The company’s scale; broad set of manufacturing, packaging and innovation capabilities; and leading food-safety track record have made Hearthside the partner of choice for its customers.

Varsity Brands is a portfolio of three brands – BSN Sports, Herff Jones and Varsity Spirit – whose products and programs celebrate academic and athletic achievement. With the largest “K through College” sales force in the United States, Varsity’s more than 1,200 sales professionals are dedicated to serving schools, sports teams and other organizations. Key products include BSN Sports’ athletic uniforms and equipment, Herff Jones’ yearbooks and graduation-related products, and Varsity Spirit’s cheerleading camps and competitions.

Galls is the leading distributor of uniforms and equipment to public safety agencies, serving law enforcement, fire, EMS, private security, corrections, federal, military and postal professionals. The company specializes in providing customized, mission-critical uniforms, safety equipment and related gear through a network of local branches, sales representatives, e-commerce sites and its proprietary “eQuip” online portal, which is customized for each agency. Each year, more than 1 million public safety professionals depend on Galls to perform their duties. The company is actively seeking to acquire complementary businesses serving law enforcement and other public safety end-markets.

Tecomet is a leading provider of high-precision manufacturing solutions for orthopedic implants, as well as critical components for the cardiovascular, medical imaging and aerospace markets. Its core capabilities include forging, casting, precision machining, photochemical etching, welding and finishing. Tecomet has the largest breadth of offerings among orthopedic outsourced manufacturers and deep partnerships with many blue-chip customers, including some of the nation’s leading medical and aerospace & defense OEMs.

QC Supply is a leading specialty distributor and solutions provider to swine and poultry markets, as well as to other production and companion animal businesses and professionals. The company offers a broad selection of brand name and proprietary products and “one stop shopping” across three business segments: consumables (items such as rubber gloves and specialty lightbulbs), equipment (systems, such as feeding and climate control, and corresponding replacement parts) and turnkey solutions (design and management of new and retrofit barn construction and the purchase and installation of related equipment). QC Supply markets its products through a combination of catalogs, a sales force and a full e-commerce platform. The company is actively seeking to acquire complementary businesses serving its agricultural end-markets.

Vestcom is the leading provider of technology-enabled shelf-edge media solutions to the retail and consumer products industry. The company offers an array of solutions including customized shelf-edge labels, branding and promotional content labels, and shelf-edge strips with product information. For Vestcom’s key grocery, drug and dollar retail end-markets, these solutions save labor hours, increase product placement and regulatory compliance, and grow sales across their customers’ 75,000 stores. Each week, Vestcom processes more than 3 billion client data points, with more than 1 billion store-specific price changes annually.

Polyconcept is the world’s largest specialty distributor of customized and personalized goods. Operating in a many-to-many distribution model, Polyconcept sources a broad assortment of merchandise from manufacturers and leading brands, and provides high-value customization, design and order management services to a network of 50,000 customers who serve the needs of millions of end-users.

Plaskolite is the largest manufacturer of acrylic and other plastic sheet (ABS, PETG and polycarbonate) in the United States. Its customized products are used in a wide variety of end products including windows, doors, lighting, signs, point-of-purchase displays and bath products. Plaskolite serves a diverse customer base including distributors, OEMs and retailers, offering 10 product lines and thousands of SKUs.

Ensono (formerly Acxiom IT) provides complex managed hosting and cloud infrastructure services to mid-sized enterprises. The company specializes in supporting mission-critical workloads and helping clients manage and migrate between all systems. Ensono’s integrated array of solutions includes the hosting of client server, mainframe and cloud computing workloads, as well as database, storage and managed network services. Ensono has historically differentiated itself through its expertise in mainframe and related services. The company has been recognized by Gartner as a Top 3 provider of mainframe services and a Top 10 provider of data center outsourcing services.

Founded in 2011, Six Degrees (6DG) is a telecommunications service provider with a converged offering of IT solutions for the UK mid-market. With 17 acquisitions to date, Six Degrees has an industry-leading portfolio of assets and capabilities, including cutting-edge data centers and cloud platforms, a next-generation data network and a state-of-the-art unified communications infrastructure.
RGL is a leading supplier of technical products required for production in Canadian oil sands and other heavy oil reservoirs.

HDT Global is a leading provider of highly engineered solutions for branches of the US military, international governments and commercial customers. Founded in 1937, HDT holds a portfolio of products aimed at creating and controlling environmental conditions to protect and optimize the functioning of critical equipment and personnel. Its innovative products include rapidly deployable shelters, sophisticated environmental control and power equipment, and nuclear, biological and chemical protection systems.

A leading global manufacturer of deep-cycle batteries, Trojan Battery provides energy storage technology for end- market applications such as fleet golf, aerial work platforms, floor cleaning, renewable energy, backup power and transportation. Trojan’s products are sold in over 120 countries through a global network of distributors and direct customers, including vehicle and equipment OEMs.

FULLBEAUTY Brands is a direct-to-consumer retailer for plus-size consumers, offering more than 10,000 products, 300,000 SKUs and 70 sizes through catalogs and an online marketplace. FULLBEAUTY includes women’s apparel lines (Woman Within, Roaman’s and Jessica London), as well as men’s line King Size, home goods brand BrylaneHome, fullbeauty.com online fashion mall and a clearance apparel website.

Founded in 1997, United Road Services is a leading provider of vehicle transport and logistics services in North America. The company operates a national network enabled by a sophisticated, patented logistics technology platform. Each year, coast to coast and across borders, United Road manages the transport of nearly 3 million vehicles. The company has approximately 1,200 company-owned vehicle carriers and 4,500 independent carriers serving 10,000 customers. These customers include major automotive manufacturers, leasing and rental companies, auction houses, wholesalers, new and used auto dealers, financing companies and individual retail customers.

The Princeton Review is a leading provider of test preparation courses and materials for prospective undergraduate and graduate students. Its test preparation services are offered online and in person by a network of more than 5,000 teachers and tutors. The majority of classes prepare students for standardized tests, such as the SAT, ACT, MCAT, GRE, GMAT and LSAT. Princeton Review also offers more than 185 print and software titles on test preparation, academic admissions and related topics. In 2014, we sold the business to a strategic buyer.

Citadel Plastics is a leading provider of custom-material solutions including both thermoplastic and engineered composites products. Citadel’s end markets include automotive, electrical, construction, HVAC, home & garden, appliance and energy. Formed in 2007, the company was built through a series of cornerstone and tuck-in acquisitions. Citadel operated 21 facilities on four continents and offered more than 2,400 products at the time of our exit in 2015, when we sold the company to a large strategic acquirer.

Montpelier is a leading global provider of property catastrophe and specialty insurance and reinsurance focused on reinsuring losses resulting from earthquakes, hurricanes, windstorms, and other natural and man-made perils. Incorporated in 2001, Montpelier Re completed its initial public offering in 2002 and is listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: MRH). In 2015, Montpelier was acquired by a strategic buyer and we sold the last of our shares late that year.

Sound United has a broad portfolio of high-performance home audio products, including speakers, surround sound systems, sound bars, wireless music systems, amplifiers, turntables and headphones. Its products are marketed under several well-known audio brands – Denon, Marantz, Polk Audio, Classé, Definitive Technology, HEOS and Boston Acoustics. Sound United has operations in Southern California, Baltimore and Montreal, as well as in Europe and Asia, and sells to consumers in more than 130 countries.

Peacock is a leading provider of outsourced supply chain management and packaging solutions to the food industry. Peacock’s full range of services includes primary and secondary packaging of ambient, refrigerated and frozen food products. In addition, the company provides customers with project engineering, design consulting, materials management, primary food processing, warehousing and shipping services. By mid-2016, the company will have seven facilities in the Chicago area and California, totaling over 2 million square feet and including two with USDA-certified refrigerated capabilities.

OnCore Manufacturing was a leading provider of high-complexity electronics manufacturing services that now operates as NEOTech. Serving blue-chip OEM customers in the defense, healthcare and industrial markets across North America, NEOTech focuses on the design and manufacture of electronic assemblies as well as system integration. Its products are used in applications such as encrypted mobile communications, radar systems, medical equipment and broadband infrastructure. In 2015, we sold OnCore to NATEL Engineering, which renamed the combined company NEOTech.

Blueknight Energy Partners is a provider of midstream energy services. The company focuses on three main areas of operations: crude oil storage, crude oil gathering and transportation, and asphalt storage and processing services. Formed in 2007, the company is a publicly traded master limited partnership (MLP).

Cedar Creek is a leading wholesale building materials distribution company that began as one yard in Tulsa, OK, in 1977. During our ownership, the company expanded its operations to more than 30 distribution facilities providing services in 29 states. With a focus on the Midwest and Southeast, it is one of the country’s premier cedar distributors and largest lumber and manufactured wood distributors.

Sightpath Medical is a leading US provider of mobile cataract and refractive surgical equipment and services. The company serves hundreds of surgeons and facilities in both rural and urban communities nationwide.

Blacksmith Brands marketed, sold and distributed over-the-counter drug and personal care products. At acquisition, its platform consisted of five over-the-counter consumer products brands: EFFERDENT® denture cleaner; EFFERGRIP® denture adhesive cream; LUDEN’S® throat drops; NASALCROM® nasal allergy relief spray; and PEDIACARE® children’s cough and cold medicine and Gentle Vapors® waterless vaporizer. After being approached by a strategic buyer, we sold the company in 2010.

Southcross Energy is a midstream natural gas company engaged in the gathering, processing and pipeline transportation of natural gas, with a total of more than 2,700 miles of pipeline assets. The company also has three gas processing plants, two fractionators and four gas treaters, for overall system capacity of approximately 1.3 Bcf per day.

Founded in 2007, Zayo is a provider of bandwidth infrastructure and network neutral colocation and interconnection services. The company’s services allow its customers, which include telecom carriers, wireless service providers, media and content companies, and other bandwidth-intensive businesses, to transport data, voice, video and internet traffic, as well as to interconnect their networks.

Founded in 2003, StoneCastle Partners is an asset manager focused on the community banking industry, with a strong track record in managing bank trust-preferred securitizations. The company intends to continue growing its core business by leveraging its origination network and underwriting capabilities to invest in other community bank assets and liabilities through a variety of investment vehicles. Since our investment, StoneCastle has started a cash management business, which has grown to over $10 billion in AUM and also launched a publicly traded closed-end investment company (Nasdaq: BANX).

Founded in 1978, GrayWolf (formerly Horn Industrial) is a leading specialized mechanical contractor focused on the power, refinery and heavy industrial markets. The company offers fully outsourced and on-call maintenance services as well as installation services for environmental compliance projects, plant extensions, upgrades and new builds. GrayWolf’s customer base includes plant operators, industrial contractors and original equipment manufacturers.

Founded in 1987, BMS is the leading national provider of bankruptcy case management solutions to Chapter 7 trustees. The company provides bankruptcy trustees and other fiduciary customers with proprietary software products, computer hardware and support services to assist in the administration of bankruptcy cases. BMS enables trustees to automate and manage virtually all aspects of their operations, including accounting and regulatory reporting. We exited the investment in 2010.

Del Taco is the second-largest chain in the Mexican segment of the quick-service restaurant industry. At the time of our exit in 2015, the company’s network consisted of approximately 550 company-owned and franchised units in 16 states, with a concentration in California.

Founded in 1967, WorldStrides is the leading provider of supplemental educational and student travel courses in the US and abroad. At the time of our investment, the company offered programs to more than 200,000 middle and high-school students in all 50 states. Through a series of strategic acquisitions, WorldStrides has expanded its reach and today serves more than 400,000 students from middle school through graduate school in 100 countries. We largely exited the investment through a sale to a financial buyer in 2011.

Zenith Products creates innovative bathroom storage and organization products for the retail market. Products include medicine cabinets, shower caddies, shower rods and accessories. The company was formerly a division of publicly traded Masco Corporation. We exited the investment in 2014.

CIFC is a specialized bank loan asset manager and an SEC-registered investment adviser. In 2011, the CIFC parent merged its asset management business with a public company, and we sold our CLO equity and shares in the new public company in 2012-2013.

Founded in 1954, Animal Health International is a leading US marketer and distributor of animal health products. The company represents more than 1,000 manufacturers to serve a diverse market of livestock producers and owners, veterinarians and retail dealers across the United States and Canada. Products range from vaccines and pharmaceuticals to state-of-the-art equipment and software. We sold our position through an IPO and subsequent sales, exiting the company in 2007.

GSI is a leading global manufacturer and supplier of agricultural equipment to the grain, swine and poultry industries. Products include grain storage bins and related conditioning and handling equipment, as well as swine and poultry feed storage, feed delivery, confinement systems and ventilation systems. GSI’s products are marketed globally through a network of independent dealers. We sold GSI to a financial buyer in 2007.

Papa Murphy’s is the leading franchisor and operator of take-and-bake pizza stores. During our hold period, we expanded Papa Murphy’s footprint to more than 30 states in the Northwest, West and Midwest, and in Canada. We sold our investment to a financial buyer in 2010.

Aurora is a leading producer of organic milk. During our hold period, the company operated five large organic dairies in Colorado and Texas and a fluid milk-processing plant adjacent to one of its Colorado dairies. We sold the company in 2011.

Regency Gas Services was led by a team of industry executives assembled by Charlesbank. The company purchased and operated 2,900 miles of natural gas gathering, processing and pipeline assets in Colorado, Kansas, Louisiana, Oklahoma and Texas. Regency completed two acquisitions under our ownership, and we sold the company to a financial buyer in 2004.

Catlin is a specialty-lines commercial insurer and reinsurer headquartered in Bermuda with a network of underwriting platforms worldwide. The company began as a syndicate on Lloyds, went public in April 2004 and is currently traded on the London Stock Exchange (Ticker: CGL.L). In December 2006, Catlin acquired Wellington Underwriting, creating the largest underwriter operating on the Lloyd’s market. We sold our shares in a series of sales, exiting in 2011.

Founded in 1965, Universal Technical Institute is the leading provider of automotive, diesel, motorcycle and marine technician-education services in North America. At the time of our exit in 2006, UTI offered its accredited degree and diploma programs at 10 undergraduate campuses and 20 manufacturer-specific graduate training facilities.

CSI Leasing is one of the largest independent IT leasing companies in the world. At the time of our exit in 2013, the St. Louis-based company operated more than 30 sales offices in the United States, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Costa Rica, Germany and Great Britain.

Technisource (formerly IntelliMark) was originally a roll-up of 21 information technology temporary-staffing companies acquired between 1997 and 1999 by Edgewater Technology, a public company. The company, initially located in Little Rock, AR, had two primary lines of business: IT Resources and IT Solutions. IT Resources provided temporary IT staffing to Fortune 1000, mid-market and emerging-market clients and IT Solutions provided network consulting and design, integration services, help desk solutions and training. The company was bought by a strategic buyer in 2007.

Shoppers Drug Mart is the largest full-service drugstore chain in Canada. With almost 900 locations at the time of our exit, the company has long been one of the most trusted and recognized names in Canadian retailing. In 2001, Shoppers completed an IPO and we sold our final shares in 2004.
Bell Automotive is a leading designer, marketer and distributor of automotive convenience accessories such as cargo racks, drink holders and organizational products. We exited our position in 2002.

American Tire Distributors is a wholesale distributor of replacement tires for passenger cars and light-duty trucks, based in Charlotte, NC.  Founded in 1935, the company pursued an acquisition strategy to become one of the nation’s largest independent suppliers of tires to the replacement tire market. We helped the once family-owned business evolve its management and expand its geographic footprint before exiting through a sale to a financial buyer in 2005.

National Surgical Hospitals was formed to acquire, build and operate a chain of short-stay surgical hospitals specializing in orthopedic surgery, neurosurgery and other complex cases. Under our ownership, the chain grew to 15 surgical hospitals and nine ambulatory surgery centers. We exited our investment in 2011.

Bell Sports is a leading manufacturer and distributor of sports helmets and bicycle accessories worldwide. Founded in 1954, the company had US bicycle-helmet market share in excess of 60% at the time of Charlesbank’s investment. The company distributes its products through specialty stores and mass-merchant chains such as Wal-Mart and Kmart. We sold Bell to a financial buyer in 2000.
